channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: 38 RITM staff recover, 7 still under quarantine but stable
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Despite the outbreak among its ranks, the RITM was able to conduct 927 average daily tests last week.

item.title: COVID-19 recoveries in Philippines approach 1,000 as number of cases now at 7,958
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases soared past three million worldwide, with 211,099 deaths.

item.title: Duterte's 'no more peace talks' declaration not a surprise — CPP
item.author: Artemio Dumlao
item.description: Marco Valbuena, CPP information officer, pointed out that the government has had an "all out war" policy against the rebels since 2017.

item.title: Senate bill seeks creation of Philippines' Center for Disease Control
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Poe’s Senate Bill 1450 or the Pandemic Preparedness and Response Act aims to establish the country’s version of the United States’ Center for Disease Control, which will strategize and lead in communicable disease control and prevention and strengthen the country’s preparedness and response to public health emergencies.

item.title: Makati cop files criminal raps vs expat in Dasma scuffle
item.description: Police SMSgt. Roland Madrona Madrona filed the complaint on Tuesday before the Makati prosecutor’s office.

item.title: Gov't revises list of areas under enhanced community quarantine until May 15
item.description: Last week, President Rodrigo Duterte extended the lockdown of Metro Manila and high-risk other areas in the country by two weeks to further slow down the spread of the new coronavirus.

item.title: Nearly 2M Filipino tourist workers affected by COVID-pandemic — ILO report
item.author: Jeremaiah Opiniano
item.description: Nearly two million Filipino workers in the tourism sector 15.3 million tourist workers in Asia Pacific to be hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic, says a United Nations agency's arm for the said geographic region.

item.title: Cayetano, other solons file 'new normal' bill amid COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: “The foreseeable re-opening of workplaces and businesses and the resumption of economic activity halted during the period of community quarantine cannot, however, simply proceed as if things can still go back to ‘normal,’” the solons noted.

item.title: Duterte wants FDA, DOST to increase workforce, operate 'day and night'
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The chief executive also wanted the two government agencies to extend their operations to 24 hours.

item.title: FULL TEXT: Duterte's April 27 talk to the people on COVID-19
item.description: Talk to the people of President Rodrigo Roa Duterte on coronavirus disease 2019
